casebody.data:
Timothy Lee COLES, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Page TRUE, Chief Warden, Defendant-Appellee. No. 06-6007. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: May 31, 2006. Decided: June 9, 2006. Timothy Lee Coles, Appellant Pro Se. Before WILKINSON, WILLIAMS, and SHEDD, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit. See Local Rule 36(c).

PER CURIAM:

Timothy Lee Coles appeals the district court’s order accepting the recommendation of the magistrate judge and denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2000) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. See Coles v. True, No. CA-05-218-3 (E.D. Va. filed Dec. 13, 2005 & entered Dec. 14, 2005). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
